newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian capital account convertibility to wait - RBI.
newsitem.headline: Indian capital account convertibility to wait - RBI.

text.p: Reserve Bank of India Governor C. Rangarajan said on Tuesday that full convertibility of the rupee on capital account would have to wait and could be introduced only in stages.

"I would say full capital account convertibility in the sense of total freedom, we will have to wait. Capital account convertibilty can be introduced in India only in stages," Rangarajan told a conference on foreign investment.
The central bank governor said foreign institutional investors could already convert the rupee on capital account.
"They have capital account convertiblity," he said. "We are steadily and in a planned manner enlarging the manner in which Indian residents can raise funds."

He said there were three conditions for moving to full capital account convertibility. He cited a comfortable level of reserves, a "price situation" in India similar to that prevailing elsewhere and lower interest rates.
